intro: Picris japonica var. kaimaensis, commonly known as the Kaimaen picris, is a rare variant of the Japanese picris. It is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its yellow composite flowers and linear leaves. Native to specific regions in Japan, it thrives in moist, shaded environments such as mountainous forests. The plant has small, hairy stems and produces seeds in a distinctive, flattened structure. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
